{{Infobox figure skater |name= Laureano Ibarra |image= |caption= |country= [[United States]] |fullname= Laureano Ibarra |altname= Larry Ibarra |birth_date= {{birth date and age|1983|4|22}} |birth_place= [[Miami, Florida]] |hometown= |residence= [[Colorado Springs, Colorado]] |height= {{height|ft=5|in=8}} |partner= |formerpartner= [[Meeran Trombley]]
Yesenia Camero
[[Tiffany Vise]]
Brandilyn Sandoval
Stephanie Kuban |coach= |formercoach= [[Dalilah Sappenfield]] |choreographer=[[Damon Allen (figure skater)|Damon Allen]], [[Dalilah Sappenfield]] |formerchoreographer= |skating club= All Year FSC |retired= 2009 |combined total= 132.42 |combined date= [[2007 Skate America]] |SP score= 45.48 |SP date= [[2007 Skate America]] |FS score= 86.94 |FS date= [[2007 Skate America]] }} '''Laureano Ibarra''' (born April 22, 1983 in [[Miami]], [[Florida]]) is an [[United States|American]] retired competitive [[pair skater]]. ==Biography== Ibarra was born in Miami, but raised in [[Venezuela]]. He began skating at age 11 after watching a Russian circus that included skating. Ibarra eventually moved back to Miami to train.{{cite news |first=Beverley |last=Smith |authorlink= |coauthors= |title=Petrusca skated until the cows came home |url=http://www.theglobeandmail.com/servlet/story/RTGAM.20071028.WBglobesports20071028163235/WBStory/WBglobesports |work= |publisher=[[Globe and Mail]] |date=2007-10-28|accessdate=2007-10-31 }} His parents died when he was twelve and he was adopted by [[Dalilah Sappenfield]] and her husband. He competed with Yesenia Camero, then [[Tiffany Vise]] from 2001â2003, Brandilyn Sandoval from 2003 through 2004, and Stephanie Kuban from 2004 through 2006. With Vise, he is the [[United States Figure Skating Championships|2002 U.S. Junior national bronze medalist]]. They placed 6th at the [[2002 World Junior Figure Skating Championships]] and won two medals on the [[Junior Grand Prix]]. Ibarra teamed up with Trombley in March 2006.{{cite news | url = http://www.skatetoday.com/2008/04/23/traveling-pair/ | title = Traveling Pair | last = Mittan | first = Barry | date = April 23, 2008 | publisher = SkateToday | accessdate = August 8, 2011}} They placed fifth at the [[2007 Skate America]]. Their partnership ended following the 2008-2009 season when both retired from comeptitive skating. ==Competitive highlights== (with Trombley) {| class="wikitable" |- ! Event ! 2001-2002 ! 2002-2003 |- | [[World Junior Figure Skating Championships|World Junior Championships]] || align="center" | 6th || |- | [[United States Figure Skating Championships|U.S. Championships]] || align="center" bgcolor="#cc9966" | 3rd J. || align="center" | 11th |- | [[2002-2003 ISU Junior Grand Prix|Junior Grand Prix, Slovakia]] || || align="center" bgcolor="#cc9966" | 3rd |- | [[2002-2003 ISU Junior Grand Prix|Junior Grand Prix, China]] || || align="center" bgcolor="silver" | 2nd |- | Midwestern Sectionals || align="center" bgcolor="gold" | 1st J. || align="center" bgcolor="gold" | 1st |} * J = Junior level ==References== {{reflist}} ==External links== * {{usfsa name | category=AthletePairBio | id=39685 | name=Laureano Ibarra}} * {{isu name | id=00010206 | name=Meeran Tromblay & Laureano Ibarra}} * {{isu name | id=00005554 | name=Tiffany Vise & Laureano Ibarra}} * [http://www.pairsonice.net/record.php?f=Sandoval&m=Ibarra Pairs on Ice: Sandoval & Ibarra] * [http://www.pairsonice.net/record.php?f=Kuban&m=Ibarra Pairs on Ice: Kuban & Ibarra] * [http://www.pairsonice.net/record.php?f=Vise&m=Ibarra Pairs on Ice: Vise & Ibarra] * [http://spokane2007.usfigureskating.org/Athletes/Senior/~/media/478238F4F41E470D897FC4273E2B759D.ashx 2007 Nationals bio] * {{PDFlink|[http://stlouis2006.usfigureskating.org/upload/general/athletes/senior/pairs/kubanibarra.pdf 2006 Nationals bio]|22.0 [[Kibibyte|KiB]]}} {{Persondata | NAME = Ibarra, Laureano | ALTERNATIVE NAMES = | SHORT DESCRIPTION = | DATE OF BIRTH = April 22, 1983 | PLACE OF BIRTH = [[Miami, Florida]] | DATE OF DEATH = | PLACE OF DEATH = }} {{DEFAULTSORT:Ibarra, Laureano}} [[Category:1983 births]] [[Category:American pair skaters]] [[Category:Living people]] [[Category:People from Miami, Florida]] [[Category:American adoptees]] {{US-figure-skating-bio-stub}}
